intro: Erysimum scabrum, commonly known as rough wallflower, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like cabbage and mustard. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and produces bright yellow flowers with four petals. Its leaves are rough and hairy, giving it a distinctive appearance. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or coastal areas.
